pageContext._xxxcollectionDescriptionxtxt: From 1932 to the mid-1940s, Paul Rhymer's "Vic and Sade" was one of the more popular and critically acclaimed afternoon radio shows in all America. Rhymer (1905-1964) grew up in Bloomington, attended Illinois Wesleyan University, and wrote for The Pantagraph before moving to Chicago and enjoying tremendous success in the radio business. The collection includes 51 episodes from the years from 1932 to 1944.
_xcollectionFormatsxtxtxxxcollectionForm: Optical disc (including CD, CD-R, CD-RW, DVD, DVD-R, DVD-RW, VCD)
